abstract.para: The Statement of Work agreement between Princeton University Library (PUL) and Digital Divide Data (DDD) for the conversion of the Russian emigre newspaper, Vozrozhdenie. It supersedes all prior statements of work and production schedules, whether produced by EDDA or by PU'S, in whatever form.

sect1.title: Rationale
sect1.para: There are approximately 28,500 page images. The issues of Vozrozhdenie have been bound into volumes; Princeton shot the original pages as 24-bit RGB TIFF files at a resolution of 7200 pixels on the long side, then, to improve OCR, created grayscale derivatives with level adjustments: black 10, white 215, gamma 1.15.

sect1.title: Reference Documents
sect1.para: The Vozrozhdenie Project has detailed its policies, requirements, and formats in a Reference Document, maintained and distributed on the wiki at the Vozrozhdenie Project's gitHub portal https://github.com/pulibrary/vozrozhdenie/wiki.

sect1.title: Plan of Work
sect1.para: The Work shall be divided into discrete units (hereafter referred to as batches, deliveries, or tranches), as defined in the section below. Processing of each unit shall follow this procedure:

step.title: Input Files from PUL
step.para: PUL shall provide image files in the format specified in the reference documentation. PUL shall arrange these image files as a series of directories (folders) organized by the bound volume in which the originals appear. Princeton shall make every reasonable effort to ensure these issue sets are accurate and complete. If, upon DDD's inspection at receipt, there are missing pages, duplicate pages, or other directory-level or file-level anomalies which impede or otherwise interfere with DDD's subsequent processing of the materials, DDD shall inform Princeton immediately for remedy. Princeton shall not be responsible for redundant work performed by DDD in remedy of such anomalies.
The image files shall be made available to DDD via PUL's FTP server; access credentials will be supplied to DDD privately.
DDD shall process the page images and descriptive metadata into METS/ALTO, JPEG2000, and PDF outputs (the PRODUCT) according to the standard CCS docWorks Newspaper configuration.
DDD shall deliver the Product to PUL via PUL's FTP server.

Princeton shall ingest the Product into its content-management system and the Veridian content-delivery system. Princeton shall evaluate the Product, in its raw form and in its deployed form, and shall notify DDD in a timely fashion of any anomalies outside the tolerances set forth below.
Princeton shall have 30 days to request corrections. At the end of 30 days, Princeton shall either (a) accept the work and pay the invoice; or (b) reject the work and delete it from its systems.

sect1.title: Schedule of Work
sect1.para: The schedule shall be maintained as a set of milestones in the Project's Goplan tracking system.

sect2.title: Quality Evaluation Guidelines
sect2.para: When DDD has completed a batch, it shall submit output to Princeton for ingestion into Princeton's Veridian installation.
Upon receipt of a batch, Princeton will have 30 days to accept or reject it. Princeton will employ the following procedures to evaluate a batch.

step.title: Evaluation of Zoning and Segmentation
step.para: Princeton will examine five (5) issues for zoning and segmentation errors. A zoning or segmentation error shall be identified using the following criteria:

listitem.para: If an article is missing one or more zones, that shall count as an error.
If an article contains one or more zones that are not part of the article in the original, it shall be counted as an error.
If the sequence of zoned regions is not in the proper order, it shall count as an error.

sect2.para: Princeton will record the results of these examinations in its report. If significant errors are discovered, Princeton and DDD will confer.

step.para: Princeton will draw a random sample of 350 headlines from the batch and measure its accuracy by comparing each headline with its original and recording all significant errors. The accuracy rate of the sample should meet or exceed 99.5%.
Princeton will examine the fifth article in every sample (as above) for errors in the body text, counting the number of significant errors that occur, where significance is as defined above.
We shall assume an average article length of 500 words. For an accuracy rate of 90% or better an article should therefore contain no more than 50 significant errors.
Princeton and DDD shall agree that if more than 5% of the samples from a given batch fail, the batch is not acceptable.

Princeton will evaluate 1 random 2,000 character sampling of Issue Metadata. If the sample contains more than 1 error (i.e., it falls below 99.95%), the issue metadata fails and must be rechecked and resubmitted by DDD.
Princeton will not verify XML validity, as docWorks automatically validates the files it produces against the appropriate schemas.

sect1.title: Payment Terms
sect1.para: DDD shall issue an invoice to Princeton for EXACTLY the work performed in fulfillment of this batch. PUL will not accept invoices that fail to specify, in detail, the work being billed, or that bill for work that spans discrete batches, or that entail work done for other Princeton-related projects.

sect1.title: Mediation and Arbitration
sect1.para: In the event of a dispute under this Agreement, the parties agree to submit such dispute to non-binding mediation and to use their best efforts in resolving such a dispute through mediation. In the event the parties are unable to resolve such a dispute through mediation, then such dispute or other controversy arising under or in connection with this Agreement shall be settled exclusively by Arbitration conducted before an Arbitrator in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect. Said Arbitration shall be held in New York, New York. The decision of the Arbitrator shall be final and binding on both parties and their heirs and legal representatives. Judgment may be entered upon the Arbitratorâ€™s award in any court located in New York, New York. Each party shall be responsible to pay for its own costs in connection with the Arbitration and the parties shall bear the costs of Arbitration itself and the mediation in equal shares.

sect1.title: Successors and Assigns
sect1.para: The parties agree that this Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of each of the parties hereto and their successors and assigns.

sect1.title: Cooperation
sect1.para: Each party hereto agrees to cooperate with the other in carrying out the terms of this Agreement. In connection therewith, each party agrees to execute such documents and take such steps as may be necessary or advisable to carry out the purposes of this Agreement, whether before or after the date of this Agreement.
